modules.title: Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
modules.description: Comprehensive AI and ML module with blocks on Artificial Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, Recurrent Neural Networks, Autoencoders, model analysis and application, as well as ethical issues. Mathematical topics such as differentiation, integration, and linear algebra were covered so that those techniques could be applied when training and optimising machine learning models.

resources.title: Data Mining: Practical Machine Learning Tools and Techniques
resources.author: Ian H. Witten, Eibe Frank, Mark A. Hall and Christopher J. Pal

modules.title: Software Engineering
modules.description: Software system development as an engineering activity, modelling software systems (UML), Agile and non-Agile approaches, requirements engineering (functional/non-functional types, relationship between requirements and testing), use case models, business domain modelling, structural modelling (conceptual models and object/class models, relationships/associations, constraints/invariants), dynamic modelling, software architectures, design patterns, quality requirements.

assessments.title: TMA01
assessments.description: Use case models and user stories, activity diagrams, Agile methodologies, Volere templates.

assessments.title: TMA02
assessments.description: Problem domain modelling, analysis modelling, associations/multiplicities, pre and post conditions of system operations.

assessments.title: TMA03
assessments.description: Enterprise system architecture (Jakarta), design patterns, testing

resources.title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
resources.author: Gamma E., Helm R., Johnson R., Vlissides J.,

modules.title: Data management and analysis
modules.description: Focused on DBMS architectures and implementation, in both relational (PostgreSQL) and NoSQL contexts (MongoDB, a document database). The module begins with the data analysis pipeline, and relevant technologies such as pandas for tabular visualisations and seaborn for graphs. Then more in depth relational database work which involved data modelling, normalisation, subqueries/views, and concurrency. The NoSQL portion of the module focused on document databases with the appropriate data analysis techniques, as well as scaling the databases (replication/sharding/distributed transactions). The module concluded with data warehousing, data mining, and linked semantic web dataset interactions (eg. OWL and RDF languages).

resources.title: MongoDB: The Definitive Guide
resources.author: Bradshaw S., Brazil E., and Chodorow K.

modules.title: The Computing and IT Project
modules.description: A flexible project module that can be based on any of the previous topics covered throughout the course. My project was applying machine learning techniques to detect accessibility errors in source code. This involved trialing different approaches and evaluating their perfomance, and iterating further on the most promising results.

modules.title: Web Technologies
modules.description: Comprehensive web technology module from tech fundamentals (HTML, CSS) to topics such as accessibility, security, web standards, and architectures (Client-Server etc). Web APIs/HTTP/REST/AJAX and programming languages (JavaScript and PHP - SPAs, SSGs, SSRs) are covered in depth in different scenarios to show various use cases.

assessments.title: TMA01
assessments.description: Museum landing page and report (HTML, CSS)

assessments.title: TMA02
assessments.description: Guesthouse CRUD web application and report (PHP, JavaScript, SQL, Regex, HTML, CSS)

assessments.title: TMA03
assessments.description: Guesthouse photo diary web application (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)

assessments.title: EMA
assessments.description: Walking Club website project (design, implementation, testing) (PHP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS)

modules.title: Communication and Information Technologies
modules.description: General networking and communications module. Information storage, radio transmission and mobile communication (IoT, 1-5G etc) and security/error control are covered in Block 1. Block 2 covered general interaction design and team collaboration, human-computer interactions with a focus on user interfaces and relevant heuristics. Block 3 covered cybersecurity, encryption, and ethical concerns related to biometric information processing and storage as well as the societal risks of artificial intelligence.

assessments.title: TMA01
assessments.description: 5G, asynchronous communication technologies, access point configuration (Packet Tracer)

assessments.title: TMA02
assessments.description: Hotel Website Group Project (design, implementation, reflection) (WordPress)

assessments.title: TMA03
assessments.description: Ethical and Legal Frameworks of IT, Biometric Authentication Systems report (written assessments)

modules.title: Algorithms, Data Structures and Computability
modules.description: Algorithms and complexity (Big-O notation), runtime analysis, data structures (lists, stacks, queues, dictionaries, sets, trees, graphs, search algorithms, recursion, greedy). Python and Jupyter Notebooks. Logic, theoretical computer science, and computability (eg. P != NP, halting problem etc). Content was covered through practical Python programming exercises and Notebooks projects.

assessments.title: TMA01
assessments.description: Part 1: Sequence data types, iterative algorithms, and algorithm complexity - Part 2: Stacks, queues, and priority Queues (Python)

assessments.title: TMA02
assessments.description: Binary Trees, graphs, recursive functions and graphs, greedy algorithms (Python)

assessments.title: TMA03
assessments.description: Sets, bags, maps, and logic (Propositional/Predicate) and well Formed Formulas, truth tables, Equivalence Problem essay (Python, SQL)

resources.title: Logic and the Limits of Computing
resources.author: The Open University

modules.title: Object-oriented Java Programming
modules.description: Fundamentals of object-oriented programming taught with the BlueJ IDE and Java.

assessments.title: TMA02
assessments.description: Rock Paper Scissors game, Dictionary HashMaps and HashSets, SIR Infection Rate model (Java)

assessments.title: TMA03
assessments.description: Roller Coaster Manager, Sailing Club and Boat Race Manager - Member/organisation project that could read/write CSV files (Java)

resources.title: Discovering Mathematics Books: A, B, C, D
resources.author: Various Authors

modules.title: Technologies in Practise
modules.description: Networking, operating systems (Linux, architectures and virtualisation), robotics and AI

modules.title: Introduction to Computing and Information Technology 2
modules.description: Block 1: Computer hardware and architecture, data management, cloud computing, mobile devices - Block 2: Python programming and algorithms - Block 3: Security, hacking, surveillance

modules.title: Introduction to Computing and Information Technology 1
modules.description: IT fundamentals, programming, and networking. Digital foundations and technologies were covered, including XML and binary as well as databases, including big data and cloud computing concepts. Most topics included a relevant socio-technical example to emphasise the connection between digital technology and society.

modules.title: Diploma in Computer Programming
modules.description: Eleven week course on OOP fundamentals in Java. Skills such as development environment management, CLI compilation, and NetBeans IDE were taught. Computational problem solving and algorithms were introduced.

assessments.title: Final Project
assessments.description: Java BMI calculator, with GUI, exception handling, and data validation.
